au.gov.ansto.bragg.process.port
Interface Port

All Superinterfaces:
au.gov.ansto.bragg.base.common.All, Common, au.gov.ansto.bragg.base.common.Publisher, java.io.Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
In, Out, Var
public interface Port
extends Common

Generic port class.

A Port can maintain and pass signal. The children classs of Port can be In, Out and Var port class. Togather they grouped as the necessary accessment to a Processor. When a Port object is created, it is configured to be able to take certain type of signal information, for example, an Integer, a Double or a double array.

Created on 20/02/2007, 9:58:24 AM

Last modified 17/04/2007, 9:58:24 AM

Since:
M1
Version:
V1.0
Author:
nxi
See Also:
In, Out, Var

Method Detail

addConsumer

void addConsumer(Port consumer)
Add a consumer to the consumer list. A consumer of this port is another port to which this port will pass the signal handle, if the signal is changed.

Parameters:
consumer - another Port instance

captureToken

void captureToken()
A token will be created if this method is called. The port becomes ready if all token are released.

See Also:
releaseToken()

configure

void configure(au.gov.ansto.bragg.process.configuration.PortConfiguration portConfiguration,
               Processor parent)
               throws au.gov.ansto.bragg.process.common.exception.IllegalNameSetException,
                      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException,
                      au.gov.ansto.bragg.process.exception.DimensionOutOfRangeException,
                      java.lang.InstantiationException,
                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException
This method configure the port with a port configuration object. It will update the port's name, type, dimension and so on.

Parameters:
portConfiguration - a port configuration object
parent - a processor in which this port is built, as Processor
Throws:
au.gov.ansto.bragg.process.common.exception.IllegalNameSetException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException
au.gov.ansto.bragg.process.exception.DimensionOutOfRangeException
java.lang.InstantiationException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException

getConsumerList

java.util.List<Port> getConsumerList()
This method gets the consumer list of the port. The consumer list contains all consumers of this port. If the signal information is updated, the port will pass the signal to all its consumers one by one.

Returns:
list of ports as List

getDimension

int getDimension()
Get the dimension information of the port. It is the dimension of the signal of the port.

Returns:
dimension as int type

getLockStatus

boolean getLockStatus()
Get the lock status of the port. If the port's information is used for a running processing of its parent processor, it is locked. After processing, the port is unlocked

Returns:
lock status as boolean type

getParent

Processor getParent()
Get the parent of the port. The parent of the port is a processor, in which the port is physically built.

Returns:
a Processor instance

getPortType

java.lang.String getPortType()
Get the signal type of the port. The signal of the port is defined as generic signal as Object. When the port is created upon a port configuration object, it will be initialized as a specific type that is defined in the recipe file. So the port type can be described as a String

Returns:
port type as String

getProducer

Port getProducer()
Get the producer of the port. A producer of the port is another port which pass its signal to this port. A port can have only one producer.

Returns:
producer as Port instance

getRecipeID

int getRecipeID()
Get the port recipe id. Receipe id is the fixed id which is parsed from the XML recipe file. In a recipe file, every port has a unique recipe id.

Returns:
recipe id in int type

getSignal

java.lang.Object getSignal()
Get the signal of the port. A generic signal in Object type is used here. The actual signal is in the type defined in the recipe file.

Returns:
generic signal in Object type

getStatus

java.lang.String getStatus()
Get the lock status of the port. This method is usually called by its proxy, that is an PortAgent object.

Returns:
lock status converted to String type

getType

java.lang.Class<?> getType()
This method gets the type of the signal of the port. It is defined in the recipe file as a string. When the port is created, it will be parsed by a ClassLoader to a class type.

Returns:
a Class type

releaseToken

void releaseToken()
                  throws au.gov.ansto.bragg.process.exception.NullMethodException,
                         java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                         java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                         java.lang.InstantiationException
Release a token of the port. The number of the tokens of the port is the number of processors that are using this port to do processing. The port are unlocked if all tokens are released

Throws:
au.gov.ansto.bragg.process.exception.NullMethodException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
java.lang.InstantiationException

setCach

void setCach(java.lang.Object signal)
             throws au.gov.ansto.bragg.process.exception.NullMethodException,
                    java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                    java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                    java.lang.InstantiationException
Set a signal to the cach of the port. A cach is a temporary holder for the signal if the port is locked.

If the port is locked, the cach will hold the signal tempararily. If the port is not locked, it will pass it to the signal property of the port.

Parameters:
signal - generic signal in Object type
Throws:
au.gov.ansto.bragg.process.exception.NullMethodException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
java.lang.InstantiationException

setDimension

void setDimension(int dimension)
Set the dimension property of the port, that is also the dimension of the signal.

Parameters:
dimension - in int type

setOutput

void setOutput(java.lang.Object signal)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Set output to this port only, which means the signal will not be passed on to its consumer. The signal stops here.

Parameters:
signal - generic signal in Object type
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

setParent

void setParent(Processor parent)
Set parent of the port. The parent of the port is a processor.

Parameters:
parent - processor as Processor object

setProducer

void setProducer(Port producer)
Set the producer of the port. A producer is another port that will pass its signal to this port when the signal is changed.

Parameters:
producer - as Port object

setReceipeID

void setReceipeID(int id)
Set the recipe id of the port. A receipe id is the one get from the XML receipe file.

Parameters:
id - recipe id in int type
See Also:
getRecipeID()

setType

void setType(java.lang.Class<?> type)
Set the type of the signal of the port.

Parameters:
type - in Class type, which is reflected by a string
See Also:
getPortType()
